You are hereAcademic Affairs Home ›  
Graduate Studies

Announcements



  Congrats to our Grad Slam Winners!: Support our 1st place winner, Rebecca Kopel from Biology, and 2nd place winner, Michelle Jones from English, as they compete in the CSU-wide Grad Slam on May 5th, 2023! Learn more here. Go SSU!
   

  Graduate Studies Mixer - February 9, 5-7PM: Thank you for coming to the Spring GRADUATE STUDIES MIXER on February 9th! We hope you had as much fun meeting other graduate students as the Grad Studies Team did! Keep an eye out for other events in the future.
   

  Congratulations to our Fall 2022 Graduates!: We are so proud of your accomplishments and wish you the best with all of your future endeavors! Let us know where you land after SSU and share your future successes, email graduate.studies@sonoma.edu!
   

  New Graduate Student Orientation Fall 2022: Please join us in-person for New Graduate Student Orientation on Friday, August 19, 2022 at 5pm in Darwin Hall 103 at SSU! A presentation of student services will be followed by light snacks and mingling. RSVP via the invitation sent to your SSU email address.
   









The Office of Graduate Studies partners with Graduate Program Coordinators to provide support to students in all of Sonoma State's master's degree programs. Graduate Studies provides students with guidance on navigating important deadlines and polices, and suppports the final steps of degree completion (see Academic Record Report, GSO2 form) and thesis review.  
We encourage graduate students to engage in all that Sonoma State has to offer. Our department hosts events every semester to participate in, from Fall's New Graduate Student Orientation, to regular semester mixers for graduate students.
Graduate Students will get the most out of the experience by utilizing SSU's world-class Library, Writing Center, Recreation Center, and by attending any of the numerous campus events. Be sure to check out the Seawolf calendar to stay informed.
